title: Newcastle vs Chelsea LIVE : Woltemade scores twice in Premier League clash
body_text:
Newcastle threw away a two-goal lead as Chelsea came from behind to secure a 2-2 draw in a thrilling game at St James’ Park on Saturday.
The Magpies were absolutely dominant in the first half with Nick Woltemade scoring twice and Chelsea failing to register a shot on target.
In the second half, Chelsea captain Reece James scored an incredible free-kick from 25 yards out before Newcastle were controversially denied a penalty for Trevoh Chalobah’s challenge on Anthony Gordon.
Joao Pedro levelled it up for the Blues just after the hour mark and both sides pushed for a late winner but they ended up with a point each.
Here’s how it all unfolded…

Why Newcastle were denied controversial penalty
The Premier League Match Centre has explained why Newcastle’s Anthony Gordon was denied a penalty against Chelsea, but the explanation is not washing with everyone.
McCoist: Might be the best game I’ve seen this season
Ally McCoist, who was on commentary duties for TNT Sports, said: ‘Might just be the best game I’ve seen this season. Newcastle in the first half, I can’t tell you how good they were.
‘You have to give Chelsea credit [for the comeback]. I’m buzzing with the game of football we’ve watched.’
James: It was a game of two halves
Chelsea captain Reece James, talking to TNT Sports after the match, said: ‘It was a game of two halves. In the first half, they got the better of us. Second half we had to review it, change a few things, and we started the second half quick. It turned quickly.
‘The messages [at half-time] were more demanding, more effort… there were too many second balls they won in the first half that we needed to tighten up on. And we did that in the second half.’
FULL TIME: Newcastle 2-2 Chelsea
What. A. Game. It’s all over here as both sides gain a point. The Newcastle fans are furious with the referee and boo him off.
Newcastle denied another penalty!
90+5: VAR is checking for a Newcastle penalty as James appears to pull down Barnes – but it’s not given. My word…
Willock comes on for Newcastle
89: Late change for Newcastle as Willock replaces Ramsey.
Chance for Elanga!
89: Elanga almost wins it for Newcastle – but his shot is just wide of the far post. Five minutes to be added on…
Surely a winner is coming…
88: Sorry if I have cursed it by saying this… But I’d be amazed if there’s not a winning goal here. Just can’t call which way it’s going to go!
Hall booked!
87: Hall is the ninth player to be shown a yellow card… Can either team find a winner here?
Chance for Barnes!
85: A massive chance for Barnes to win it for Newcastle but he can’t hit the target.
It’s still 2-2 here. What a game this has been!
Joao Pedro booked!
83: An insane amount of yellow cards in this match. Joao Pedro this time.
Andrey Santos booked!
82: Andrey Santos is booked for an off-the-ball foul on Elanga. Crazy game this.
Palmer heads to the bench
79: Chelsea are taking off Palmer – who is replaced by Andrey Santos.
Wissa booked!
77: Wissa has been on the pitch for less than five minutes but he’s booked for a foul on Garnacho.
Premier League release statement on controversial penalty decision
Newcastle make three changes
73: Barnes, Wissa and Elanga all come on for Newcastle. They replace Gordon, Woltemade and Murphy.
Caicedo booked!
70: Yet another yellow card for Chelsea. Caicedo is booked for a foul on Hall.
Joao Pedro levels it up for Chelsea!
66: WHAT A GAME!!! Chelsea have come back from 2-0 down to level up this match!
Joao Pedro with the goal as goalkeeper Robert Sanchez provides the assist.
